author: Anonymous Comp
title: Check Syntax
question:
1. What is the difference between check syntax and failing check expects?
2. Do you get 0% if you submit a failing check expect? I just want to make sure.
student_answer:
1. Failing check syntax means that when you try running the function you get an error message in the interactions tab like this:
,
which usually happens from misspelling a tag or function, forgetting brackets, etc. If you submit this, there is a chance you get 0.
2. There are two ways to fail check-expects: the first is when your code runs properly but there is some error in the logic and you get a failing test like this:
.
In this case, I don't think you would get a 0.
The second case is when your code doesn't run properly and returns an error message in the test results:
.
In this case, I am unsure if you could get a 0 or not.
instructor_answer:
Good student answer, just to add, failing check-expects has never resulted in you getting a total 0, of course, there are stipulations but in general no.
Failing check-syntax will lose up to 100% of marks as stated on the exam instructions site.
